intro: Impatiens fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features showy, spurred flowers that are usually pink or red, with five petals and a distinctive elongated spur. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Impatiens fasciculata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
